attributes.action: Make it illegal for any UK school/college/university to lie or mislead students.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.macclesfield.ac.uk/courses16-18/ft-course-subject.aspx?sid=70

Doesn't clearly state that both general and some other course give the same qualification at the end of a two year course
attributes.background:
-Misleading course content
-Hiding details that/may benefit the student
-have a honest representation from teachers/higher ups.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, we're not sure what you mean by "hiding details that may benefit the student" or "have an honest representation from teachers/ higher ups".

If you think that a university, school, or collage has provided false information in its advertising, you may wish to make a complaint to the Advertising Standards Authority (ASA). The ASA is responsible for regulating advertising and is independent. You can find out how to make a complaint to the ASA here: 
https://www.asa.org.uk/make-a-complaint.html
